feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 8:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: Periods of moderate precipitation has caused rises to the Susitna River and tributary creeks and streams in the Susitna Valley, including Willow Creek. Smaller rivers may see water levels at bankfull, however, flooding is not expected. Rainfall will diminish later today.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 11:21PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Snowfall Above 3000 feet Tuesday Into Wednesday... Snow is expected to develop above 3000 feet early on Tuesday and continue into Wednesday. Up to 6 inches of snow is possible above 3000 ft.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 11:19PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Windy with Blowing Snow Above 3000 Feet Late Tonight Into Tuesday... Southwest winds gusting to 40 mph are expected to develop above 3000 ft late tonight and continue into Tuesday. Snow and blowing snow with low visibility is expected to develop late tonight above 3000 feet and continue into Tuesday morning. This will

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 11:17PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Above 3000 Feet Late Tonight Into Tuesday... Snow is expected to develop late tonight above 3000 feet and continue into Tuesday. Up to 3 inches is possible in Atigun Pass. with lesser amounts just below pass level.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 19 at 4:37PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... Lane Regional Air Protection Agency has issued an Air Quality Advisory, which is in effect until 11 AM PDT Wednesday. In Eugene and Springfield, air quality of “unhealthy for sensitive groups” is expected in the mornings with improved air quality each afternoon.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 5:26AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today. Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing and take frequent breaks from the heat. Young children and pets should never be left

entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 658 AND 659... entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued September 20 at 3:00AM PDT until September 20 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty north winds and dry conditions Tuesday... .North winds will increase down the Okanogan Valley Tuesday. Strong winds will be coupled with dry conditions Tuesday afternoon into the early evening increasing the potential for rapid spread of any new fires. Winds will peak in the early afternoon and decrease early Tuesday evening.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued September 20 at 2:58PM CDT until September 20 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR NORTHEASTERN LAFAYETTE... NORTHWESTERN GREEN...SOUTHEASTERN IOWA AND SOUTHWESTERN DANE COUNTIES IS CANCELLED... The storm which prompted the warning has moved out of the area. Therefore, the warning has been cancelled.

entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Ozaukee, Milwaukee, northern Walworth, northern Rock, northwestern Racine, Waukesha, southeastern Dane, southern Washington, Jefferson and southeastern Dodge Counties through 345 PM CDT... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 2:43PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Lafayette, Green and southwestern Rock Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 243 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Blanchardville, or 13 miles northeast of Darlington, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 20 at 12:53PM CDT until September 20 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Life threatening waves of 3 to 5 feet and dangerous currents are expected. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Sheboygan, Ozaukee, Milwaukee, Racine, and Kenosha counties.
